q: What is Edwards' syndrome?
a: Edwards' syndrome, also known as trisomy 18, is a rare but serious condition where a baby has 3 copies of chromosome number 18 instead of 2, affecting their growth and development. Most babies with Edwards' syndrome will die before or shortly after being born.
